results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Churchill Films

video_links.name: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale

results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.

results.title: Possums of Bonegilla
results.creator_credit: Agnes Karlik and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Agnes talks of her migrant experience including her time spent at Bonegilla. She especially focuses on friendships made during those early years of alienation and loneliness.

results.title: Always a farmer
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Not just a farmer’s wife, Jenny Grigg, mother of four and business partner in all ways with her husband on their Mallee sheep and grain farm discovered a group of women who were to change Jenny’s life forever.
This story is dedicated to that network of women (PinG) who help and support other farming women in grains by providing inspiration and encouragement and a feeling of self-worth.

results.title: Innamorati
results.brief_description:
Assembled from family photographs, home movies and background music, Roberta Ciabarra narrates a poignant story of her parent’s courtship and unusual marriage as they migrate separately to Australia to establish a new life.

First created as part of the pilot 3 day digital storytelling workshop conducted at Cinemedia by Nina Mullen and Joe Lambert from the Center for Digital Storytelling, Berkeley, CA.

results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

video_links.name: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

results.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.title_for_label: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.description: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.
description_for_label: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.

group_siblings.title: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune

video_links.name: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune

results.title: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune

video_links.name: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune

results.brief_description: An aging astronomer invites students to his castle observatory to observe a solar eclipse. Amid the childish pranks of the novice astronomers and the wondrous vision of the eclipse, George Melies, cinema’s great magician, weaves numerous amusing set pieces. Much to the astronomer’s excitement, the sun and the moon flirt with each other as they come together in an astronomical courtship and the sky explodes in a dance of female stars. On earth, the astronomer falls prey to his cheeky students who rob him of his stately dignity, while the heavens smile down on him from above.
